result.execSummary:
The defendant Demario Marvell Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: concurrent to case 19CM2291. Huber Privileges for work and school.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample by 5pm on 8/9/2022.
Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
No new laws rising to the level of probable cause.

Absolute sobriety.  Drug testing by breathalyzer, unless defendant has a valid prescription.  
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Obtain a GED/HSED or high school diploma.
Seek and maintain fulltime employment.

Complete a cognitive thinking program.
Complete a firearms safety course at MATC.
Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demario Marvell Robinson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demario Robinson in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Demario Robinson.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served, concurrent to case 19CM2291.  Huber Privileges for work and school.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:

- Report for Probation by 5pm on 8/9/2022.
- No new laws rising to the level of probable cause.
- Absolute sobriety.  Drug testing by breathalyzer, unless defendant has a valid prescription.  
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Obtain a GED/HSED or high school diploma.
- Seek and maintain fulltime employment.
- Complete a cognitive thinking program.
- Perform 30 hours of community service.
- Complete a firearms safety course at MATC.
- Provide a DNA sample by 5pm on 8/9/2022.

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

*** Court will grant expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Defendant Demario Robinson in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Demario Robinson.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

AS TO COUNT 2: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed but read-in for sentencing purposes.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Demario Marvell Robinson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.   Case calendared for a Status Conference. 
Defense counsel request a plea and sentencing date. 
Parties advised: Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Court ordered matter adjourned.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Demario Marvell Robinson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.
Case in court for a status conference. Defense is missing discovery from the State and requests an adjournment.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Demario Marvell Robinson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Demario Marvell Robinson appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and no an offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 19. Status Conference is scheduled on June 10, 2022 at 08:30am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Richards.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Ashley, Br. 19.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (3-24-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Demario Marvell Robinson in court.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.

ADDRESS INFO for Demario Marvell Robinson
Current: 6537 North Beale Street #5, Milwaukee, WI 53224   (Effective: 03-22-2022)
Prior: 6537 North Beale Street #305, Milwaukee, WI 53224
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Demario Marvell Robinson not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/28/22 @ 2p
